sentences.english: Full moon on a clear and concrete short life declares.
sentences.chinese: 月圆月缺是具体而微的人生昭示。

sentences.english: It heralds the time for women to embark on a journey for self-exploration has come.
sentences.chinese: 这昭示着女性将踏上一条漫长的自我探索之路。

sentences.english: Verily We have brought the Truth to you: but most of you have a hatred for Truth.
sentences.chinese: 我确已把真理昭示你们，但你们大半是厌恶真理的。

sentences.english: The next race in Silverstone will tell more.
sentences.chinese: 下一站在银石的比赛会昭示更多。

sentences.english: Perhaps the fraud revealed at the beginning of the year should have been a tip-off.
sentences.chinese: 或许骗局在年初就应该得到昭示。

sentences.english: He clearly shows us the direction of oriental arts towards the internationalization.
sentences.chinese: 他为东方艺术走向国际化给与了我们最好的昭示。

sentences.english: They represent a Minmatar's identity as well as his story.
sentences.chinese: 像历史一样清晰的昭示着米玛塔尔人的身份。

sentences.english: And his achievement in African leadership prize celebrates exemplars of his philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 他通过建立“非洲领导奖”昭示了他的人生哲学。

sentences.english: Yuxin's literary creation is characterized by the value of the compatible culture.
sentences.chinese: 庾信的创作中昭示出兼容并蓄的文化价值取向。

definition: to hold in store/to contain (untapped reserves etc)
to assign/to entrust (a task)/to give/to bestow
to be full of (emotion)/to brim with (love, tears etc)
to recount/to narrate/to give an account of
to come to prominence/to appear clearly/to stick out
to contain in a concealed form/to keep covered up/implicit
